definition: lit. when one beats a dog, one must answer to its master (idiom)/fig. before punishing sb, one should consider how that would affect others associated with him
pinyin: da3 gou3 hai2 dei3 kan4 zhu3 ren2

lit. not for the monk's sake but for the Buddha's sake (idiom)/fig. (to do sth for sb) out of deference to sb else
pinyin: bu4 kan4 seng1 mian4 kan4 fo2 mian4

definition: a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
lit. strong dragon cannot repress a snake (idiom); fig. a local gangster who is above the law

definition: extremely daring (idiom)/foolhardy
It's all exaggeration, you don't need to take it seriously/a fuss about nothing/nothing to write home about

definition: lit. to kill a chicken in front of a monkey; fig. to make an example of sb (by punishment) to frighten others
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.

definition: to bully intolerably (idiom)
to wave a chicken feather as a token of authority (idiom); to assume unwarranted authority on the basis of some pretext
pinyin: na2 zhe5 ji1 mao2 dang4 ling4 jian4

definition: unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
the elbow turns the wrong way/to favor an outsider instead of someone on one's own side (idiom)
